meanings.sent1: She played the qins beautifully during the concert.
meanings.sent2: The musician practiced the qins every day to improve her skills.
meanings.sent3: The qins seemed to have a magical melody that captivated everyone.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the qins echoed through the room like a gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the qins made it a unique and special instrument.

meanings.sent1: He exchanged his dollars for qins before his trip to China.
meanings.sent2: The shop only accepted qins as payment for the souvenirs.
meanings.sent3: Finding a lucky qins on the street felt like a fortunate sign.
meanings.sent4: Her savings in qins grew steadily over the years.
meanings.sent5: The value of the qins fluctuated with the economic changes in China.

meanings.definition: A unit of weight in ancient China.
meanings.sent1: The merchant measured the spices using qins as the unit.
meanings.sent2: The ancient texts mentioned the use of qins for weighing gold.
meanings.sent3: Carrying the heavy qins around all day was exhausting for the workers.
meanings.sent4: The qins of rice was carefully portioned out for each meal.
meanings.sent5: The scale balanced perfectly with the exact qins of stones on each side.
